name: Ammo Box
desc: This small portable Ammo Box partially refills your weapons' extra ammunition, including special ammunition types.

name: Medical Pack
desc: A portable medical kit that heals 100 health. Deployable in active health emergencies.

name: Choke Beetle
desc: Choke Beetles are bred to find and track prey, giving Hunters a view from above. They have also evolved to explode into a cloud of suffocating gas, which they themselves are immune to.

name: Antidote Shot (Weak)
desc: Instantly cures and prevents all poison effects. Physical damage associated with poison attacks still applies.

name: Antidote Shot
desc: Instantly cures and prevents all poison effects. Physical damage associated with poison attacks still applies.

name: Tool Box
desc: A portable toolkit that refills some dwindling supplies in a tight spot.

name: Sticky Bomb
desc: Dynamite charge in a sticky frame that can be attached to objects and enemies. Its eight-second fuse doubles the detonation time of a dynamite stick.

name: Regeneration Shot (Weak)
desc: A shot that continually restores health over a short duration.

name: Regeneration Shot
desc: A shot that continuously restores health until fully healed.

name: Stamina Shot (Weak)
desc: A shot which immediately restores all stamina and stops further depletion for 5 minutes.

name: Stamina Shot
desc: A shot which immediately restores all stamina and stops further depletion for 10 minutes.

name: Vitality Shot (Weak)
desc: A shot which immediately restores 75 health.

name: Vitality Shot
desc: A shot which immediately restores all health.

name: Fire Bomb
desc: Flammable liquid in a glass container that bursts on impact. Spreads burning liquid over a large area.

name: Liquid Fire Bomb
desc: Flammable liquid in a glass container. Burns on the surface of water. Internal steel balls cause it to burst on impact.

name: Hellfire Bomb
desc: Flammable liquid in a glass container that bursts on impact and creates a massive fireball.

name: Fire Beetle
desc: Fire Beetles are bred to find and track prey, giving Hunters a view from above. Upon death or command, they will burst into flames that burn everything they touch.

name: Stalker Beetle
desc: Stalker Beetles are bred to find and track prey, giving hunters a view from above. As a last resort, they can sacrifice themselves to cause a small explosion, hampering anything caught in the radius.

name: Hive Bomb
desc: Poisonous wasps emerge from this bomb to terrorize anyone unfortunate enough to be in the area. However it has no effect on monsters.

name: Poison Bomb
desc: On detonation emits a persistent, deadly cloud. Anything caught in or that passes through the cloud will be poisoned.

description: Spring-loaded razorwire coil that unfolds violently when thrown. Shreds and entangles anything that tries to move through.

name: Flash Bomb
desc: Light bomb that requires a short priming for its mercury based chemical reaction. The explosion is capable of blinding all in close proximity, even if their eyes are shielded or averted. Needs a short time to be prepared.

name: Chaos Bomb
desc: Set of firecrackers that can be used to temporarily distract nearby enemies. Duration of about 30 seconds.

name: Big Dynamite Bundle
desc: A bundle of many dynamite sticks, for when something really needs to be blown up.

name: Dynamite Bundle
desc: A bundle of several dynamite sticks. Why only bring one?

name: Dynamite Stick
desc: A dynamite stick that detonates with a massive blast after four seconds.

name: Frag Bomb
desc: Frag bombs send lethal shrapnel over a large area, lacerating nearby enemies. Unlike dynamite however, the blast is not strong enough to destroy doors or concertina wire.

name: Waxed Dynamite Stick
desc: A dynamite stick with a modified powder fuse that enables detonation under water and in choke bomb clouds.
